entry.title: Portland Barcamp 2012
entry.content:
Made the journey up to Portland for my first Barcamp. Joined by a couple of buddies from the KMUZ, we arrived to witness the scheduling process. I decided to just observe this time, but Nate pitched a session. It was a very interesting process.

First Session

My first session of the morning was lead by a contributor to the linux kernel. Lot's deep CS discussion.

Second Session

Next, I participated in a discussion on bug data and some of the issues created from user input.

Lunch

We grabbed lunch at a great middle-eastern deli called All Spice Deli.

Third Session

This session focused on testing/UX testing. Learned a lot about boundary testing, Equivalence partitioning and other testing procdures

  • http://code.google.com/p/fighting-layout-bugs/
  • https://github.com/GaloisInc/FiveUI

entry.title: How I followed a tutorial to create my blog in one day.
entry.content:
I followed this simple tutorial to create a nice looking blog hosted on Github. It was pretty straight forward.

One key component left out is -- you need to edit the rake file to create your posts. This is not done in his example, unless I am missing something. Overall though, its a well thought out article. I would not recommend this method for those of you who cannot write HTML or are scared off by simple Ruby syntax. I like that I can tweak and script the site. I think I am going to have a bit of fun with this.

Feel free to take a look at the code. I made some improvements and fixed a couple of the issues with the original article. If you want to contribute, submit a pull request or fork the repository.

TODO's --
